io.gearpump.streaming.source

Interface DataSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TimeReplayableSource, TypedDataSource<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CollectionDataSource

    public interface DataSource
extends java.io.Serializable
    interface to implement custom source where data is read into the system. a DataSource could be a message queue like kafka or simply data generation source.

    an example would be like 

    
  GenStringSource extends DataSource {

    def open(context: TaskContext, startTime: Option[TimeStamp]): Unit = {}

    def read(batchSize: Int): List[Message] = {
      List.fill(batchSize)(Message("message"))
    }

    def close(): Unit = {}
  }

    subclass is required to be serializable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      close connection to data source.
      void open(TaskContext context, scala.Option<java.lang.Object> startTime)
      open connection to data source invoked in onStart() method of DataSourceTask
      scala.collection.immutable.List<io.gearpump.Message> read(int batchSize)
      read a number of messages from data source.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open(TaskContext context,
          scala.Option<java.lang.Object> startTime)
        open connection to data source invoked in onStart() method of DataSourceTask
        Parameters:
        context - is the task context at runtime
        startTime - is the start time of system

      • read

        scala.collection.immutable.List<io.gearpump.Message> read(int batchSize)
        read a number of messages from data source. invoked in each onNext() method of DataSourceTask
        Parameters:
        batchSize - max number of messages to read
        Returns:
        a list of messages wrapped in Message

      • close

        void close()
        close connection to data source. invoked in onStop() method of DataSourceTask
